intro: Aldama truxillensis, commonly known as the Truxillense Aldama, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
